content: I’ve been writing a Chess AI for one of my university classes and there are a few things that were glossed over or skipped. A-B Pruning and Minimax are not chess specific. I’d be curious the kind of optimizations that could be done because of the defined problem space. As nice as libraries like Chess JS are, going into more depth about how bitboards work and generating movements from that would be more interesting, especially to non-JS developers. More advanced topics include Pondering and (what I’d be most interested in) Magic BitBoards.
